src:
16 Karateka Kata Perorangan Raih Tiket PON 2020
05 Nov 2019, 05:19 by Agus Rusmin


16 Karateka Kata Perorangan Raih Tiket PON 2020

KBRN, Jakarta : Sebanyak delapan karateka kata perorangan putra dan delapan karateka perorangan putri lolos ke Pekan Olahraga Nasional (PON) 2020 Papua. Mereka mampu merebut tiket ajang multievent nasional itu setelah bersaing ketat pada hari pertama Kejuaraan Nasional Prakualifikasi PON 2019 di Hall Basket Gelora Bung Karno, Jakarta, Senin (4/11/2019). 
Kedelapan karateka putra itu adalah Ahmad Ziqi Zaresta Yuda (Nusa Tenggara Barat), Erlando Stevano (Jambi), Andi Dasril Dwi Dharmawan (Sulawesi Selatan), M Ivan Fairuz Taher (Jawa Barat), Hans Saputra Indrawan (Jawa Timur), Candra Nevo (DKI Jakarta), Detrina Sabda Nugraha (Jawa Tengah}, dan Muhammad Saifa Alim (Kalimantan Selatan). 
Sementara karateka kata putri yang lolos adalah Marzella Sekar Damayanti (Banten), Krisda Putri Aprilia (Sulawesi Selatan), Nawar Kautsar Matsura (Jawa Barat), dan Sisilia Agustiani Ora (Jawa Timur). Sedangkan empat karateka putri lainnya yang lolos ke Papua adalah Ms Ningsih (Sulawesi Tengah), Cintya Auraria (Jambi), Putri Azhani Amelia (Sumatera Barat), dan Ervikhasananty (DKI Jakarta).
"Selain di nomor kata, kejurnas ini juga akan menjaring 8 karateka nomor Kumite putra dan putri yang berhak tampil di PON Papua," jelas Raja Sapta Ervian Sekjen PB Forki.
text:
16 Karateka Individual Words Win PON 2020 Tickets
05 Nov 2019, 05:19 by Agus Rusmin


16 Karateka Individual Words Win PON 2020 Tickets

KBRN, Jakarta: A total of eight individual male words and eight female individual karateka qualify for Papua 2020 National Sports Week (PON). They were able to win the national multi-event event ticket after tight competition on the first day of the PON 2019 Prequalification National Championship at the Bung Karno Basketball Hall, Jakarta, Monday (11/04/2019).
The eight male characters are Ahmad Ziqi Zaresta Yuda (West Nusa Tenggara), Erlando Stevano (Jambi), Andi Dasril Dwi Dharmawan (South Sulawesi), M Ivan Fairuz Taher (West Java), Hans Saputra Indrawan (East Java), Candra Nevo (East Java), DKI Jakarta), Detrina Sabda Nugraha (Central Java}, and Muhammad Saifa Alim (South Kalimantan).
While the karateka words of princesses who escaped were Marzella Sekar Damayanti (Banten), Krisda Putri Aprilia (South Sulawesi), Nawar Kautsar Matsura (West Java), and Sicily Agustiani Ora (East Java). While the four other female characters who escaped to Papua were Ms Ningsih (Central Sulawesi), Cintya Auraria (Jambi), Putri Azhani Amelia (West Sumatra), and Ervikhasananty (DKI Jakarta).
"Aside from the word number, this National Championship will also encompass 8 karateka numbers of male and female Kumite who are entitled to appear in PON Papua," explained Raja Sapta Ervian Secretary General PB Forki.
